question_text: To what extent do you think that the use of AI technologies for facial recognition for border control will be beneficial?
survey_organisation: Ada Lovelace Institute & The Alan Turing Institute
response_scale: Very beneficial, Somewhat beneficial, Not very beneficial, Not at all beneficial, Don't know / Prefer not to say
notes: Agreement combines 'Very beneficial' (42%) and 'Somewhat beneficial' (45%). Disagreement combines 'Not very beneficial' (6%) and 'Not at all beneficial' (2%). N_respondents is weighted sample size. Fieldwork conducted November-December 2022.

question_text: Overall, the benefits of U.S. government use of facial recognition technology outweigh its risks.
response_scale: Strongly Agree, Agree, Neither Agree nor Disagree, Disagree, Strongly Disagree, Don't Know/It Depends, Prefer not to Say
notes: Agreement combines 'Agree or strongly agree'. Disagreement combines 'Disagree or strongly disagree'. Neutral combines 'Neither agree nor disagree', 'Don't know/it depends', and 'Prefer not to say'. Percentages derived from text on page 37 and Figure 4.2 on page 38. The 41% neutral/ambiguous/did not answer is explicitly stated for this question on page 37. The 34% agreement is also stated on page 38. The remaining 25% is calculated as 100 - 34 - 41.

question_text: I trust the U.S. government's use of facial recognition technology.
